Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Seminalplasmin (Calcium transport inhibitor; Peptide YY-2; mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacterium:Escherichia coli.Fungi:Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Candida ablicans.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Binding Target: Does not bind directly to calcium. It binds to calmodulin in the presence of Ca2+.
Sequence Information.Function: Inhibits calcium transport into spermatozoa; it does not bind directly to calcium. Binds to calmodulin. Inhibits the growth of microorganisms. Seem to act as an antibiotic by permeabilizing the bacterial membrane.

Literature.Title: Amino acid sequence of seminalplasmin, an antimicrobial protein from bull semen.
Literature.Author: Theil R, Scheit KH.

Literature.Title: Functional properties of peptides derived from seminalplasmin binding to monospecific anti-seminalplasmin immunoglobulins G and calmodulin.
Literature.Author: Krauhs E, Preuss KD, Scheit KH.

Literature.Title: The structure of caltrin, the calcium-transport inhibitor of bovine seminal plasma.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1985 Oct;82(19)6490-6491.
Literature.Author: Lewis RV, Agustin JS, Kruggel W, Lardy HA.
